sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: has been developed and tested using Matlab 7.5 (R2007b) running on Linux and Windows XP. Any other Matlab supported platform should work.
As of version 1.02 Octave (version >2.1.64) is supported as well.

sect2.title: Local Installation
sect2.para: If you run Matlab with Java extensions (the default), you can run the pathtool, select the install directory (and subfolder GUI), and save the path and you are done ; >> pathtool

To install without the Java gui (using 'matlab -nojvm') you can manually add the folder to Matlabs search path. If you unpack to /usr/share/matlab/SegyMAT simply do :
>> addpath /usr/share/matlab/SegyMAT -begin >> addpath /usr/share/matlab/SegyMAT/GUI -begin

sect2.title: Global Installation
sect2.para:
For a system wide installation add the following line (substituting the location of the directory)
>> addpath /usr/share/matlab/SegyMAT -begin >> addpath /usr/share/matlab/SegyMAT/GUI -begin
to pathdef.m, usually located in $MATLAB_INSTALL/toolbox/local/pathdef.m
